topic.title: Getting Started
topic.shortdesc: Installing, configuring, and launching Oxygen PDF Chemistry from a command line.

section.p: With Chemistry you can get PDF out of HTML or XML documents, by styling them with CSS. It is a paged media CSS processor based on the Open source Apache FOP XSL-FO engine. Its main purpose is to give you a simple tool that let you leverage your CSS knowledge in creating printable deliverables. While the support for fancy formatting is limited, it does a good job with technical documentation.

section.title: Using CSS for Print
section.p: While CSS was designed as a language to style web pages, it turned out to be a good candidate to format also printed materials. The so called paged media CSS module was thus added by W3C to the existing standard.

This module adds new concepts like:
page size
page breaks
headers, footers
footnotes
links containing the target page number
leaders - to fill spaces
You may find the specification for paged media here: CSS Paged Media Module and the CSS Generated Content for Paged Media Module.

body.p: There are many other processors that implement paged media standard: Prince XML, Antenna House, PDF Reactor.
